programme.title: KAU DITAKDIRKAN UNTUKKU 62 [P13]
programme.desc: Alya is a tough, independent tomboy girl. He must care for his mother, who has kidney disease, in a life full of challenges. Alya must provide for her family's living expenses in addition to caring for her mother and nephew. After that, he endured difficult work and had to confront the sometimes-difficult realities.

programme.title: IPA & IPS EPS 398 [P13]
programme.desc: IPA & IPS tells about school children in choosing different school majors. As is known, each high school has two majors to choose from, namely IPA (Natural Science) and IPS (Social Sciences). There are two friends who choose different majors so that their friendship is split, even both of them make science and social science students enemies. It started with two friends, Rifki and Aldino who became enemies because they chose different majors

programme.title: CINTA TANPA KARENA EPS 140 [P13]
programme.desc: Couple of lovers who are prevented from being together by their parents' approval. They are Dipta (Megantara) and Nuna (Ochi Rosdiana), and they must maintain their love in secret. Due to Nuna's mother's blockade, their love tale must overcome numerous challenges

programme.title: THEATER DRAMA : CINTAKU ASLI 100% [P13]
programme.desc: A program drama FTV about love, friendship, family, happy, sad etc, played by popular actor and actress Indonesia.

programme.title: IKATAN CINTA EPS 1237 [P13]
programme.desc: It tells the story of Aldebaran (Arya Saloka) who initially wanted to avenge the death of his sister and ended up marrying Andin (Amanda Manopo) who was imprisoned due to accusations by his sister, Elsa (Glenca Chysara). When all is revealed, Elsa is serving her sentence because she is the real culprit. Nino (Evan Sanders) who is Andin's ex-husband is now obsessed with Reyna, his daughter and Andin. Al Fahri's family survived and their happiness increased with the birth of Askara. Watch today's episode of Bond of Love!

programme.title: MENCINTAIMU SEKALI LAGI EPS 201 [P13]
programme.desc: Arini, a successful woman, faces deep wounds due to her lover, Donny's affair with her best friend, Laura. programme.desc: Couple of lovers who are prevented from being together by their parents' approval. They are Dipta (Megantara) and Nuna (Ochi Rosdiana), and they must maintain their love in secret. Due to Nuna's mother's blockade, their love tale must overcome numerous challenges

programme.title: THEATER DRAMA : CINTAKU BUKAN CINTA BUAYA [P13]
programme.desc: A program drama FTV about love, friendship, family, happy, sad etc, played by popular actor and actress Indonesia.

programme.title: IKATAN CINTA EPS 1238 [P13]
programme.desc: It tells the story of Aldebaran (Arya Saloka) who initially wanted to avenge the death of his sister and ended up marrying Andin (Amanda Manopo) who was imprisoned due to accusations by his sister, Elsa (Glenca Chysara). When all is revealed, Elsa is serving her sentence because she is the real culprit. Nino (Evan Sanders) who is Andin's ex-husband is now obsessed with Reyna, his daughter and Andin. Al Fahri's family survived and their happiness increased with the birth of Askara. Watch today's episode of Bond of Love!

programme.title: MENCINTAIMU SEKALI LAGI EPS 202 [P13]
programme.desc: Arini, a successful woman, faces deep wounds due to her lover, Donny's affair with her best friend, Laura. In her slump, her mother tries to match her with Lingga, the son of their family friend. Although initially refusing, Arini begins to open her heart thanks to Lingga's sincerity.

programme.title: TERBELENGGU RINDU EPS 324 [P13]
programme.desc: The tale of Amira, a stunning, kind, and kind woman who always has an optimistic outlook on life. Her life was good at first, but she became too depressed to live after the deaths of her husband and daughter, as well as other issues that kept happening.

programme.title: KAU DITAKDIRKAN UNTUKKU 64 [P13]
programme.desc: Alya is a tough, independent tomboy girl. He must care for his mother, who has kidney disease, in a life full of challenges. Alya must provide for her family's living expenses in addition to caring for her mother and nephew. After that, he endured difficult work and had to confront the sometimes-difficult realities.

programme.title: IPA & IPS EPS 400 [P13]
programme.desc: IPA & IPS tells about school children in choosing different school majors. As is known, each high school has two majors to choose from, namely IPA (Natural Science) and IPS (Social Sciences). There are two friends who choose different majors so that their friendship is split, even both of them make science and social science students enemies. It started with two friends, Rifki and Aldino who became enemies because they chose different majors

programme.title: Attenborough's Life In Colour [U]
programme.desc: Millions of years ago, the first animals had eyes that were unable to distinguish color -- yet as that changed, ‘seeing in color’ gave animals many advantages, whether to find food, attract a mate or warn off an enemy.

programme.title: Attenborough's Life In Colour [U]
programme.desc: David Attenborough reveals some of the natural world’s most cunning tricksters and masters of disguise. Discover how some animals use color to hide and disappear into the background, or to trick and deceive.

programme.title: Canada: A Year In The Wild [U]
programme.desc: With days growing shorter and colder, Canadian wildlife is in a race against time, and any animal that fails to make the most of what autumn has to offer will perish.

programme.title: Canada: A Year In The Wild [U]
programme.desc: Winter in Canada is both cruel and beautiful; in the grip of snow and ice, and animals are struggling; however, while some animals hunker down, others have babies to raise who need to adjust to their environment swiftly.

programme.title: Canada: A Year In The Wild [U]
programme.desc: Spring is late this year, and when it finally arrives, the race is on to find a mate and start a family; black bears and beavers in the west, wood frogs in the south and 20,000 gannets in the east all have one thing on their minds.

programme.title: Secrets Of The Museum S3 [U]
programme.desc: This week at the V&A, a pink lamé suit for a menswear exhibit, a 10-tonne slice of Robin Hood Gardens for V&A East, a bionic arm for Young V&A, and Eric Ravilious's 'Travel' tea set are featured.

programme.title: Secrets Of The Museum S3 [U]
programme.desc: V&A curators uncover untold stories in objects, featuring African fashion, a kente cloth, a James Barnor photograph, and a puzzling 'Ancient Persian' dish.

programme.title: Secrets Of The Museum S3 [U]
programme.desc: This week, "Secrets of the Museum" spotlights industry and design. Curator Martin preps a Maurice Broomfield photo exhibit, while Jenny receives a rare Biba production file. Also featured: a jamdani stole and Josiah Wedgwood's pottery trials.

programme.title: Attenborough's Life In Colour [U]
programme.desc: David Attenborough reveals some of the natural world’s most cunning tricksters and masters of disguise. Discover how some animals use color to hide and disappear into the background, or to trick and deceive.

programme.title: Attenborough's Life In Colour [U]
programme.desc: Find out the stories behind the scientific research on animal colors - from robotic frogs wrestling with real-life counterparts, to spiders wearing eyeliner to attract mates.

programme.title: Iberia's Woodlands [U]
programme.desc: Narrated by acclaimed English actor Bill Nighy, this blue-chip natural history series reveals the challenges faced by the astounding and rare creatures that make this unique environment their home.

programme.title: A New Zealand Food Story S4 [U]
programme.desc: Ben’s travels to Hastings and discovers a holistic fully vertically integrated approach to creating grass fed Angus beef. He ventures to the local farmers market and meets amazing local food producers, reinforcing the abundance of produce grown in the region.

programme.title: A New Zealand Food Story S4 [U]
programme.desc: Ben’s meets an Orchardist and Food Innovation specialist. They have a shared vision to make all natural varietal – led apple juice, using the best technology in the world. He also checks out over 30 varieties of figs grown in the Mediterranean type climate of Hawkes Bay.

programme.title: A New Zealand Food Story S4 [U]
programme.desc: Ben takes a boat to visit a salmon farm in Akaroa and learns the difference between NZ King and Atlantic salmon. He catches salmon and cooks it on the shoreline overlooking the harbour. He checks out a high-quality homegrown culinary oil that’s both healthy and versatile, highlighting a commitment to local agriculture and sustainability.

programme.title: A New Zealand Food Story S4 [U]
programme.desc: It’s stone fruit season! Ben visits a family run orchard in Central Otago known for its long season of stone fruit and a strong connection to the land and community. He discovers an all-electric cherry farm where premium export cherries are sold direct to Kiwis.

programme.title: A New Zealand Food Story S4 [U]
programme.desc: Ben experiences the Ruapehu’s region emerging food story and rich history of market gardening. He meets a sixth generation farmer who has turned a remote wilderness into a thriving eco-tourism and fine dining destination, alongside an award winning chef.

programme.title: A New Zealand Food Story S4 [U]
programme.desc: Ben’s food journey starts in the West Coast of the South Island. He meets the only NZ cranberry producer at a farm in Hokitika and travels to Blackball to learn how chorizo is made. He cooks a range of dishes at the beach incorporating these local delicacies, matched with a local beer.

programme.title: Janet Jackson: The Art Of Seduction [U]
programme.desc: Noted for her fierce independence, her magnetic aura and her ever so charming voice, Janet Jackson became a catalyst for her growth on MTV; embracing her identity, and reaching up to the heights of stardom.

programme.title: JLo: Triple Threat [U]
programme.desc: Step into the world of Jennifer Lopez, a dominant figure in the entertainment industry whose journey from humble beginnings to A-list stardom is nothing short of inspirational.

programme.title: Beyonce: Queen & Country [U]
programme.desc: Follow the life and career of Beyoncé Knowles-Carter, from her early days as the lead singer of Destiny's Child to her solo career. Discover how the superstar's music style and inspirations have developed over the years.

programme.title: Alaska: A Year In The Wild [U]
programme.desc: Humpback whales return to Alaska's rich feeding grounds and salmon return to spawn in the rivers. The returning salmon however have to negotiate a path past hungry brown bears.

programme.title: Alaska: A Year In The Wild [U]
programme.desc: The end of winter heralds one of the world's greatest feeding frenzies as large ocean predators target the millions of fish who have found refuge in the Gulf of Alaska.

programme.title: Alaska: A Year In The Wild [U]
programme.desc: With the arrival of spring, days grow longer and temperatures rise. However, spring in Alaska is short. Animals have just two months to find food and start a family, while avoiding predators.

programme.title: The Rhino Orphanage [U]
programme.desc: It takes patience and commitment for The Rhino Orphanage, as they nurture young rhinos whose mothers have been lost to poaching.

programme.title: The Rhino Orphanage [U]
programme.desc: The two oldest rhinos are set to be released back into the wild. Three rhinos cause a stir as they go missing, while the younger rhinos make steady progress toward health and happiness.

programme.title: The Rhino Orphanage [U]
programme.desc: The poaching crisis intensifies and poachers turn their attention to orphanages. After losing her mother, four-week-old Jamila finally finds sanctuary at The Rhino Orphanage.

programme.title: Black In Space: Breaking The Color Barrier [U]
programme.desc: The Civil Rights Movement collided with the Space Race as America battled to beat the Soviets to become the first nation to send a black astronaut into orbit.

programme.title: Space Disasters [U]
programme.desc: From the earliest days of space exploration to humankind's latest endeavors, risk is always part of the equation. But for the pioneers who were the first to put NASA's unpredictable technology and unproven designs to the test, the dangers were greater.

programme.desc: People & Power is a current affairs programme on Al Jazeera English which broadcasts once a week, on Wednesdays, and repeated throughout the week.Each half-hour programme features one investigative documentaries on an issue related to power from around the world. The programme occasionally has one hour specials.

programme.title: NHK NEWSLINE
programme.desc: NHK NEWSLINE brings you up to date with the latest from Japan, Asia and around the world. Our team covers breaking news and major developments, with trusted anchors to tie it all together.

programme.title: Trails to Oishii Tokyo mini
programme.desc: Our focus this time is wasabi. Visit a culturally significant paddy field, try a unique grater that offers stronger pungency, and learn more about the cultivation history of Japan's fiery root.

programme.title: The Seasons of Yamato
programme.desc: A series of poetic videos by Koichi Hozan, a videographer living in Nara, in collaboration with a pianist, Mine Kawakami, for which she plays exclusive pieces, makes you experience each seasons.

programme.title: Ukiyoe EDO-LIFE: Doodles or Ukiyoe
programme.desc: A series of doodles by the famous artist Utagawa Kuniyoshi turn out to be carefully considered depictions of the kabuki actors of the day. What kind of artistic statement was he trying to make?

programme.title: GRAND SUMO Highlights
programme.desc: NHK WORLD-JAPAN presents a sumo highlights program for fans around the globe. Today the show features all top-division bouts from September 27, Day 14 of the Grand Sumo Tournament in Tokyo.

programme.title: Sumopedia
programme.desc: Sumopedia enriches your sumo experience with information on the techniques, traditions and famous wrestlers of the past. The rules may be simple but there is a lot more to sumo than meets the eye.

programme.title: NHK NEWSLINE
programme.desc: NHK NEWSLINE brings you up to date with the latest from Japan, Asia and around the world. Our team covers breaking news and major developments, with trusted anchors to tie it all together.

programme.title: NHK WORLD-JAPAN Special program
programme.desc: NHK WORLD-JAPAN presents a wide range of programs from news, current affairs, documentaries, etc. focusing on Japan and Asia.

programme.title: BOSAI:Large-Scale Blackouts
programme.desc: A large-scale blackout is the total loss of power in an entire region. Hokkaido's 2018 blackout had a major impact on medical care and logistics. Find out the mechanisms and how it can be prevented.

programme.title: Carving the Spirit of Fishermen
programme.desc: Hokkaido / Takeya Takayuki (model maker) Fishing boats in the herring industry-which thrived here until the 1950s-featured swirling decorations that made a big impression on Takeya, a Hokkaido native.

programme.title: NHK NEWSLINE
programme.desc: NHK NEWSLINE brings you up to date with the latest from Japan, Asia and around the world. Our team covers breaking news and major developments, with trusted anchors to tie it all together.

programme.title: Philippines' Stateless Japanese
programme.desc: After WWII, thousands of children born to Japanese fathers were left behind in the Philippines. Many became stateless. Eighty years on, 50 descendants are still fighting to be recognized as Japanese.

programme.title: NHK NEWSLINE
programme.desc: NHK NEWSLINE brings you up to date with the latest from Japan, Asia and around the world. Our team covers breaking news and major developments, with trusted anchors to tie it all together.

programme.title: Asia's "Double Global Warming"
programme.desc: After a record hot summer in 2024, the WMO has placed a focus upon Asia, where warming progresses at double the rate of the rest of the world. Specialists weigh in on potential countermeasures.

programme.title: NHK NEWSLINE
programme.desc: NHK NEWSLINE brings you up to date with the latest from Japan, Asia and around the world. Our team covers breaking news and major developments, with trusted anchors to tie it all together.

programme.title: Darwin's Amazing Animals
programme.desc: Drama unfolds just off the Japanese coast when male Asian sheephead wrasse battle for supremacy. Sporting huge forehead humps and massive jaws, they meet mouth to mouth... and not out of affection!

programme.title: Time-lapse Journey
programme.desc: Mt. Fuji, the tallest mountain in Japan, has many faces. See the beauty of these different Fujis through time-lapse photography.

programme.title: Fit With the Doctor's Cyborg
programme.desc: Come and learn "Pro Tips" and "Improvement Points" that will help you properly kick off and move your body through the air.

programme.title: Design Ah neo: Uniforms
programme.desc: Design is fun! Design feels good! Cutting-edge images and music guide children to enjoy exploring the ideas and tweaks in the designs all around us. An episode on Uniforms.

programme.title: NHK NEWSLINE
programme.desc: NHK NEWSLINE brings you up to date with the latest from Japan, Asia and around the world. Our team covers breaking news and major developments, with trusted anchors to tie it all together.

programme.title: The Professionals
programme.desc: A reconstructive surgeon restores injured body parts via unprecedented supermicrosurgery transfers, helping patients who were told they were untreatable. Hailed a genius, he connects people to hope.

programme.title: Dining With the Chef mini
programme.desc: Featured recipe: Rice Gratin with White Miso Sauce Learn about easy, delicious, and healthy cooking with Chef Rika in five minutes!

programme.title: BOSAI:Large-Scale Blackouts
programme.desc: A large-scale blackout is the total loss of power in an entire region. Hokkaido's 2018 blackout had a major impact on medical care and logistics. Find out the mechanisms and how it can be prevented.

programme.title: Carving the Spirit of Fishermen
programme.desc: Hokkaido / Takeya Takayuki (model maker) Fishing boats in the herring industry-which thrived here until the 1950s-featured swirling decorations that made a big impression on Takeya, a Hokkaido native.

programme.title: Trails to Oishii Tokyo mini
programme.desc: Our focus this time is wasabi. Visit a culturally significant paddy field, try a unique grater that offers stronger pungency, and learn more about the cultivation history of Japan's fiery root.

programme.title: The Seasons of Yamato
programme.desc: A series of poetic videos by Koichi Hozan, a videographer living in Nara, in collaboration with a pianist, Mine Kawakami, for which she plays exclusive pieces, makes you experience each seasons.

programme.title: Ukiyoe EDO-LIFE: Doodles or Ukiyoe
programme.desc: A series of doodles by the famous artist Utagawa Kuniyoshi turn out to be carefully considered depictions of the kabuki actors of the day. What kind of artistic statement was he trying to make?

programme.title: Where We Call Home
programme.desc: We follow US-born Jonathan Levine-Ogura in Hanamaki, Iwate, in his attempt to reach the 7th dan grade in kendo, and meet Canadian Ken Blaxley who crafts fishing rods in Shiwa, also in Iwate.

programme.title: NEWSROOM TOKYO
programme.desc: NEWSROOM TOKYO dives deeper into the day's news with insight and analysis, from the perspective of Japan and the rest of Asia. We put a spotlight on what you need to know to understand the issues.

programme.title: Direct Talk
programme.desc: Kanamori Jo is the artistic director of Noism, the first dance company in Japan with a permanent residency at a public theater. He discusses the importance of physical spaces for the performing arts.

programme.title: 1/10: Married By Matching Apps
programme.desc: 1 in 10 Japanese got married through online spouse-hunting services in 2020. We interview women who use matchmaking apps, including Manami, who uses multiple apps to find a perfect partner.

programme.title: Hit the Road 5minutes
programme.desc: Let's see Japan by car! We'll be driving through Hiroshima Prefecture, with our goal being the famed Itsukushima Shrine. Along the way, we'll make a few stops off the beaten path that will amaze you!

programme.title: Ukiyoe EDO-LIFE: Summer Light Show
programme.desc: We venture to the outskirts of Edo just after sunset, where a group of women and children have come to a stream to enjoy a popular summer activity. What could they be looking for among the weeds?

programme.title: NEWSROOM TOKYO
programme.desc: NEWSROOM TOKYO dives deeper into the day's news with insight and analysis, from the perspective of Japan and the rest of Asia. We put a spotlight on what you need to know to understand the issues.

programme.title: Activate Your Japanese!
programme.desc: Learn how to make the most of your Japanese skills. Watch our drama that features useful communication strategies, our snappy videos about onomatopoeia, and our documentaries on "senpai" in Japan.

programme.title: Culture Crossroads
programme.desc: RAMUNE, a descendant of Japanese emigrants to Brazil, is a performer of rakugo, Japan's traditional storytelling. Performing in multiple languages, she helps foreigners experience Japanese culture.

programme.title: HELLO! NHK WORLD-JAPAN
programme.desc: NHK WORLD-JAPAN holds regular disaster mitigation seminars for international students, providing the knowledge that foreign residents need to stay safe. We introduce a seminar at Kanazawa University.

programme.title: NHK NEWSLINE
programme.desc: NHK NEWSLINE brings you up to date with the latest from Japan, Asia and around the world. Our team covers breaking news and major developments, with trusted anchors to tie it all together.

programme.title: Seasoning the Seasons
programme.desc: This program visits places across Japan to introduce the charms of their local daily life and festivals fostered by the nation's long history.

programme.title: NHK NEWSLINE
programme.desc: NHK NEWSLINE brings you up to date with the latest from Japan, Asia and around the world. Our team covers breaking news and major developments, with trusted anchors to tie it all together.

programme.title: Medical Frontgiers
programme.desc: Recent data show constipation can lead to life-threatening conditions like stroke and chronic kidney disease. We explore the risks of self-diagnosing and a new device for managing constipation.

programme.title: NHK NEWSLINE
programme.desc: NHK NEWSLINE brings you up to date with the latest from Japan, Asia and around the world. Our team covers breaking news and major developments, with trusted anchors to tie it all together.

programme.title: Where We Call Home
programme.desc: We follow US-born Jonathan Levine-Ogura in Hanamaki, Iwate, in his attempt to reach the 7th dan grade in kendo, and meet Canadian Ken Blaxley who crafts fishing rods in Shiwa, also in Iwate.
